text:
Hello Community, I need your help and support. It turns out that we migrated the website previously hosted on AWS to HubSpot. Within this migration we do not correctly consider the redirects and we are presenting problems with 404 errors. It turns out that our website <https://mydomain.com/payments/id_dynamic>, had to rewrite with a 301 to <https://mydomain2.com> /id_dynamic.

How do I adjust the path and dynamic parameters in the domains/url-redirects functionality of the website?

Thank you very much in advance if you have had a similar experience and how you have resolved it.
I think you can resolve this with flexible pattern redirects in your HubSpot site <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/set-up-a-flexible-pattern-url-redirect>
Hi. Did you manage to solve this?. I need to embed the CRM on Twilio Flex but this is an issue.

Hi <@U01QVR44MEY>, thanks for responding in the other thread.

According to HubSpot's <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/set-up-a-flexible-pattern-url-redirect|flexible redirects docs>, I believe this works for Danny's use case?

"Original URL" field:
<https://mydomain.com/payments/*rest-of-url>	 

"Redirect to" field
<https://mydomain2.com/{rest-of-url}>

Does it not?
It definitely could be a great option. <@U064TU4993L> cross-posted to 3 different channels, so if someone is searching in the future I just wanted to make sure they could be pointed to a good answer
Hi!  I'm having the same issue, modules & templates are showing in 600+ pages when in reality they are only in a few pages.  Did you ever find an answer to this?

Hi everyone, I am new to this Slack so please let me know if there is a better channel for my question.

I am racking my brain on the right CSS fix to get my website to go to the mobile menu on tablet instead of stacking my nav.  I am using the Accelerator template from the Marketplace, which I love I just need this one tweak to help get this website over the line for this little non-profit radio station.

Can anyone assist? I'm tapped out on my CSS skills at this point.
<https://capradio.marketenginuity.com/>

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
A little help please. Has anyone implemented HubSpot within Twilio Flex?. Some functions are blocked through CORS when embedding it as an Iframe on Twilio Flex. Is there any workaround?

Hi, was looking for some help on a specific SSO login process; I spoke with our teams solutions architect but he said there was no documentation that answered my question: is it possible to capture the accesstoken cookie that maintains sessions for users and store this token for later usage? There must be some process for capturing the access and session tokens after a successful authentication?
